entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 90 to 120 mm of rain, on top of what has fallen. Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/h. Thunderstorms possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Chance of upgrade to Red Warning is reduced to minimal.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning
entry.summary:
At 05:22 pm, MetService weather radar detected severe thunderstorms near WAIPORI FALLS, DUNEDIN AIRPORT, OUTRAM and CLARKS JUNCTION.
These severe thunderstorms are moving towards the eastnortheast, and are expected to lie near DUNEDIN, DUNEDIN AIRPORT, OUTRAM and HINDON at 05:52 pm and near DUNEDIN, MOSGIEL, WARRINGTON, WAITATI, KAIKORAI, GREEN ISLAND, WHARE FLAT and HINDON at 06:22 pm.
These thunderstorms are expected to be accompanied by very heavy rain and large hail.
Impact:
Very heavy rain can cause surface and/or flash flooding about streams, gullies and urban areas, and make driving conditions extremely hazardous.
Large hail can cause significant damage to crops, orchards, vines, glasshouses and vehicles, and make driving conditions hazardous.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary:
Thunderstorms have developed in eastern parts of Otago. These thunderstorms may be associated with heavy rain and hail. Until 9pm there is a chance some thunderstorms become SEVERE with large hail (more than 20 mm in diameter) in Clutha north of Balclutha, Dunedin and North Otago.
Large hail can cause significant damage to crops, orchards, vines, glasshouses and vehicles, as well as make driving conditions hazardous.
